content.title: Covered Stent Grafts
content.description: Stents with PTFE or Dacron covering that creates a barrier between blood flow and vessel wall, used for aneurysm exclusion, fistula, trauma, and in-stent restenosis.
content.sizing: Typically oversized 10-20% for adequate seal zone
content.statement: Covered Stent Grafts is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Procedures Stent that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Covered Stent Grafts helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Covered Stent Grafts include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Covered Stent Grafts.

citations.source: UpToDate. (2024). Covered Stent Grafts. Wolters Kluwer.
Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
